newsitem.title: USA: KSW Inc says officers boost stake in firm.
newsitem.headline: KSW Inc says officers boost stake in firm.

text.p: KSW Inc said its chief executive and chief operating officer boosted their stakes in the company by buying a combined 625,000 shares in a private transaction.

CEO Floyd Warkol and COO Burton Reyer bought the stock from Susan Barnes, who now owns 11 percent of the company's shares. Warkol, who bought 480,000 of the 625,000 shares, now owns one million shares. Reyer owns 405,000, a company spokesman said.
The company, which make and installs air conditing and heating units, has 5,458,000 million shares outstanding, it added.
Warkol is the company's largest shareholder, with about 28 percent of the stock, the spokesman said.
